poem:
GenCast

In the machine's embrace,  
wind whispers equations—  
a sky divined  
by electric thoughts,  
unknowing of bouquets,  
of petals—raindrops—  
on cold asphalt.

Tomorrow's breath,  
in circuits drawn,  
outpaces nature's sigh—  
clouds parsed  
by the whispered hum  
of coded dreams.

Yet tulips blush still  
in morning's wake,  
unaware  
of their measurable fate.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Google DeepMind predicts weather more accurately than leading system For those who keep an eye on the elements, the outlook is bright: researchers have built an artificial intelligence-based weather forecast that makes faster and more accurate predictions than the best system available today. GenCast, an AI weather program from Google DeepMind, performed up to 20% better than the ENS forecast from the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF), widely regarded as the world leader.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Google DeepMind predicts weather more accurately than leading system For those who keep an eye on the elements, the outlook is bright: researchers have built an artificial intelligence-based weather forecast that makes faster and more accurate predictions than the best system available today. GenCast, an AI weather program from Google DeepMind, performed up to 20% better than the ENS forecast from the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF), widely regarded as the world leader.
